item.title: Working with Quarto and Hugo
item.description: Quick intro to Quarto While exploring the offerings of Fast.ai, I got introduced to Quarto, a handy-looking open-source publishing system. In practice, Quarto allows publishing your work – were it code, data analysis, or just plain markdown text – in a variety of formats including PowerPoint, HTML, and so on. As a practical example I decided to try Quarto out by creating a very quick data exploration notebook as the system has a nice integration with Hugo.

item.title: Learning by doing: Setting up a website with Hugo and GitHub Pages
item.description: I just set up this website with GitHub Pages and Hugo so why not share that experience on that very website? It only makes sense! Somewhat irrelevant background information I have tried a variety of blogging platforms (e.g. Wordpress) in the past but I never got around to creating or hosting a website myself. Doing something like that sounded interesting for learning purposes, so why not try it out? Well, to be honest, I am not really “creating” the website myself now either because I ended up using Hugo, nor am I actually hosting it myself as I opted for using GitHub Pages.
